meanings.sent1: He felt a sharp dunt on his shoulder.
meanings.sent2: The boxer delivered a powerful dunt to his opponent's jaw.
meanings.sent3: The dunt from the hammer echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent4: The dunt of the gavel silenced the courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The dunt of the drum signaled the start of the performance.

meanings.definition: To strike or hit with force.
meanings.sent1: She dunted the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter dunted the chisel against the wood.
meanings.sent3: He dunted the ball so hard it flew over the fence.
meanings.sent4: The storm dunted the trees with relentless rain.
meanings.sent5: The chef dunted the dough to shape the bread.

meanings.sent1: The dunt of the falling rock echoed in the canyon.
meanings.sent2: The dunt of the distant thunder signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The dunt of the old clock filled the room with a comforting rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The dunt of the heavy book hitting the table startled everyone.
meanings.sent5: The dunt of the door closing echoed through the empty house.
